subject: Medicine
title: Placebos in Sports
description: A micro-lesson that makes Placebos in Sports usable.

hook.text: Athletes given fake performance boosters still run faster.

buildup.text: Believing a supplement works can unlock hidden reserves.

discovery.text: Cyclists told they had caffeine produced more power output.

twist.text: Even knowing the truth, conditioned athletes still improve.

climax.text: Sports psychology now uses placebo principles in training.

punchline.text: Belief adds real watts to the pedal.

quiz.question: What happened when cyclists were given fake caffeine?
options: There was no change in performance
